intro: Ficus lyrata, commonly known as the fiddle-leaf fig, is a tropical plant native to western Africa. It is characterized by its large, violin-shaped leaves that give it its common name. The plant has a sturdy, upright growth habit and can reach heights of up to 10 feet in optimal conditions. Its leaves are typically a deep green with a glossy texture, and it produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers. Ficus lyrata is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
